result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Clyde Ferron

defendant.name: Ferron, Timothy Clyde
defendant.address: 3020 Co Hwy MM, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Timothy C Ferron in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Timothy C Ferron.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Reetz indicates not resolved.  Atty Reetz requested jury trial in CM case, this case will follow that case. Bond remains in effect.
Court lifts Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: GPS Monitoring. Defendant has to stay 100yds from victims residence or where she is located.  All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

11:01 AM Defendant Timothy C Ferron in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Timothy C Ferron.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Reetz indicates not resolved. This case will track other case being set for trial.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:32 PM   Defendant Timothy Clyde Ferron not in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz not in court. Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file.  Because of a medical emergency with Atty Reetz, court reschedules matter to 10/03/22, when defendant is already scheduled to be in court.

11:58 AM  Defendant Timothy Clyde Ferron not in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Timothy Clyde Ferron.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Reetz on defendants whereabouts.  Atty Reetz unsure of defendant's whereabouts, requests new date.  Court reschedules hearing.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Motion to Modify Bond.   Pamela: Schedule hearing on this. Could be 1:15 sometime next week. DTE
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:18 PM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy C Ferron in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Timothy C Ferron.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz indicates they are waiting for a global offer from the State to resolve both matters, requests another status.  State will get an offer to Atty Reetz shortly, has no objection to another status being set.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:41 PM    Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy C Ferron in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Timothy C Ferron.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim., requests a status be set.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/12/22.

Request for Warrant for Communications, Warrant for Content of Communications, Affidavit of Sgt. Inv. Jason Stenzel, Probable Cause Findings and Orders re: Warrant, Sealing Order and Order to Not Notify re: Warrant, Return of Warrant for Documents  (Warrant shall remain under seal until 8/14/22)
The original document was titled: Request for Warrant for Communications, Warrant for Content of Communications, Affidavit of Sgt. Inv. Jason Stenzel, Probable Cause Findings and Orders re: Warrant, Sealing Order and Order to Not Notify re: Warrant, Return of Warrant for Documents
The original history event date is: 05-17-2022

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release.  GPS Monitoring - within 100 yards of victims home.  No contact direct or indirect with J.J.W. & B.L.D., their residence or places of employment.

1:00 pm.  Defendant Timothy Clyde Ferron appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared by video for Timothy Clyde Ferron.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 6/13/22 at 2:00 pm.
